local_only_traces.note: These files contain historical personal identity but are LOCAL ONLY and NOT pushed to remote repositories. They do not pose a security risk for public release.

global_git_config.user.name: Jeremy Green
global_git_config.note: Global config contains personal identity but this ONLY affects NEW commits. All existing commits in this repository use the local config and are clean.

warnings.description: Global git config contains personal identity. This does not affect existing commits but could affect future commits if local config is removed.
warnings.remediation: Maintain local git config in this repository to override global settings. Current local config is correct.

conclusion.summary: Repository is COMPLETELY CLEAN for public release. All 59 commits contain only organizational identity (Code Developer <code-developer@democratize.technology>). No personal information found in tracked files, git history, or commit metadata.
conclusion.false_positive_explanation: The reported issue about 'Jeremy Green <hello@jeremy.green>' is a FALSE POSITIVE. This identity exists ONLY in local .git/logs/ (reflog files) which are NOT part of the git repository history and are NEVER pushed to remote repositories. These are local-only metadata files used by git for recovery operations.
